articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: UK inflation at lowest since late 2016, stokes rate cut talk
articles.description: Official figures show that inflation in Britain has fallen to its lowest level since late 2016
articles.content:
LONDON -- 
Inflation in Britain has fallen to its lowest level since late 2016, official figures showed Wednesday, in a development that is likely to heighten expectations that the Bank of England will cut interest rates later this month.

articles.author: Kelly Terez, Jon Haworth
articles.title: 'Start Here': House to deliver impeachment articles to Senate as new evidence emerges
articles.description: It's Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2019. Here's what you need to know to start your day.
articles.content:
It's Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2019. Let's start here.
1. Impeachment delivery
The House is set to deliver articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate today as new evidence regarding the Ukrainian pressure campaign has emerged.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Spain: Search for missing person after chemical blast
articles.description: Authorities in northeastern Spain have resumed the search for a worker who is missing since a massive explosion at a petrochemical plant on Tuesday night killed one person and injured eight more
articles.content:
BARCELONA, Spain -- 
Authorities in northeastern Spain on Wednesday resumed the search for a worker who is missing since a massive explosion at a petrochemical plant killed one person and injured eight others.
The regional firefighters for Catalonia said 30… [+546 chars]

articles.title: Sudan reopens airspace after end of armed mutiny; 2 killed
articles.description: Sudan says it has reopened its airspace after an armed revolt from within its security forces shut down the capital’s airport and left at least two people dead
articles.content:
CAIRO -- 
Sudan said it reopened its airspace on Wednesday after an armed revolt from within its security forces shut down the capitals airport for hours and left at least two people dead.
In a press conference, Gen. Abdel-Fattah Burhan, head of the country… [+1929 chars]

articles.title: Environmental issues top worries for those heading to Davos
articles.description: A survey of key decision-makers carried out for the World Economic Forum identifies environmental issues as the top five global risks over the coming decade
articles.content:
LONDON -- 
Environmental issues dominate the global risks for top decision-makers over the coming decade, organizers of next week's World Economic Forum in the Swiss ski resort of Davos said Wednesday.

TEHRAN, Iran -- 
Iran's state-run media say British ambassador to Iran leaves the country after being arrested and briefly detained.

articles.title: China: Possible that new virus could spread between humans
articles.description: Chinese officials say they have not ruled the potential for limited human-to-human transmission of a new virus in the central city of Wuhan
articles.content:
BEIJING -- 
The possibility that a new virus in central China could spread between humans cannot be ruled out, though the risk of transmission at the moment appears to be low, Chinese officials said Wednesday.

articles.title: German economic growth slows to 0.6% in 2019
